posts.post_content:
this article is a bunch of misinformation.   
1. "beginning of the next end steps" is a 1 time trigger opposed the " beginning of the end step" which happens every end step  
 card that have this in standard  
 Argent Sphinx, Elemental Appeal, Glimmerpoint Stag, Gruesome Encore, Mimic Vat, Postmortem Lunge,   
 Splinter Twin, Stone Idol Trap, Venser, the Sojourner , Zektar Shrine Expedition   
 there is a couple more but the can only be used on opponents turn or is stupid to stop  
 All of these can be abused by waiting till the trigger is put on the stack ( which is at the beginning of the next end {these trigger are 1 time only effects} ) once on stack use sun dial to remove them.  
2. it can be used on any thing that has triggered ability during combat step  
 ie they cast regenerate once that goes on stack it is remove but if they have mana they can put it back   
 on stack after sundial is activated  
 card like Crumbling Coloss... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
I love this card. Why?  
  
It enables you to play [Phage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=40545) as your Commander.   
  
Yes, [that Phage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=106427). Search for the sundial, play her, then end the turn! Sure, you can also do it with [Platinum Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Platinum Angel), but out of 100 cards, you need as many ways as you can get. Especially since [Stifle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stifle) and [Time Stop](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Time Stop) aren't black.

posts.post_content: SO many possibilities for this card. Aside from the obvious of countering spells, you can evoke a creature like [Mulldrifter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mulldrifter) or [Shriekmaw](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shriekmaw) and then exile the sacrifice clause, or use it to keep various things from being sacrificed at the beginning of the next end step, such as the token from [Zektar Shrine expedition](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Zektar Shrine expedition) or those from [Elemental mastery](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elemental mastery) to amass a horde of elementals. Use it with [Glimmerpoint stag](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Glimmerpoint stag) to permanently exile something, as well as other cards with the same type of wording. If you want to be cruel you can use this with [smokestack](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=smokestack) in order to add counters but skip the sacrifice effect. Brutal.
posts.html:
SO many possibilities for this card. Aside from the obvious of countering spells, you can evoke a creature like Mulldrifter or Shriekmaw and then exile the sacrifice clause, or use it to keep various things from being sacrificed at the beginning of the next end step, such as the token from Zektar Shrine expedition or those from Elemental mastery to amass a horde of elementals. Use it with Glimmerpoint stag to permanently exile something, as well as other cards with the same type of wording. If you want to be cruel you can use this with smokestack in order to add counters but skip the sacrifice effect. Brutal.

posts.post_content:
@Ataogatogatog  
  
This will do what [Time Stop](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Time Stop) does, i.e. it will exile the counterspell as well as your spell, and any other spells or abilities on the stack.  
  
Yet another card that lets you play [Phyrexian Dreadnought](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian Dreadnought) for cheap.  
  
I think a more unique combo potential is with negative upkeep abilities that affect all players and a handful of instants or flashy cards. Stuff like [Reality Twist](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Reality Twist), but less evil.

posts.post_content:
Okay folks, just spoke to an upper level judge last night at FNM. This card does NOT skip your end step. You cannot play it with mimic vat (which is what I tried to do) and keep your token in play. What it actually does is it makes your end step come that much quicker.  
  
Okay, so what's the use?  
  
Here's an example, as he gave it to me.  
  
You attack. Somebody bolts your creature. You play Sundial to end the turn. All spells on the stack are exiled, meaning the bolt fizzles and your creature stays alive.   
  
So in essence, it is kind of like tossing a counterspell in an iscochron scepter. It's a reusable counterspell for things like that.  
  
It can also be used to keep oblivion ring from leaving play when the exiled card returns using Venser. The explanation for that was long and confusing but it makes sense.  
  
Bottom Line: This card doesn't have as many uses as people think. Eventually, WOTC will write up all the rules clarifications for this piece of work and everybody will be on the same pag... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
Okay folks, just spoke to an upper level judge last night at FNM. This card does NOT skip your end step. You cannot play it with mimic vat (which is what I tried to do) and keep your token in play. What it actually does is it makes your end step come that much quicker.

Okay, so what's the use?

Here's an example, as he gave it to me.

You attack. Somebody bolts your creature. You play Sundial to end the turn. All spells on the stack are exiled, meaning the bolt fizzles and your creature stays alive.

So in essence, it is kind of like tossing a counterspell in an iscochron scepter. It's a reusable counterspell for things like that.

It can also be used to keep oblivion ring from leaving play when the exiled card returns using Venser. The explanation for that was long and confusing but it makes sense.

Bottom Line: This card doesn't have as many uses as people think. Eventually, WOTC will write up all the rules clarifications for this piece of work and everybody will be on the same pag... (see all)

posts.post_content:
Here's how this card interacts with end step/end of turn effects:  
**1.** If you activate this before your end step, the end step is skipped entirely.  
 - **1a.** Anything that triggers "at the beginning of the next end step" will not trigger during your turn, but it will trigger the next time an end step actually happens (generally, on your opponent's end step.)  
 - **1b.** Anything that triggers "at the beginning of your next end step" will not trigger during your turn, but it will trigger the next time there is an end step during your turn. You can delay this trigger indefinitely by skipping your end step every turn.  
 - **1c.** Any effect that triggers at the beginning of the end step of a specific turn (see also [Final Fortune](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Final Fortune)) will not trigger at all if that turn's end step is skipped.  
**2.** If you activate this during your end step, while a beginning-of-end-step trigger is on the stack, that ability will not resolve. It will not trigger again unle... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
Here's how this card interacts with end step/end of turn effects:
1. If you activate this before your end step, the end step is skipped entirely.
- 1a. Anything that triggers "at the beginning of the next end step" will not trigger during your turn, but it will trigger the next time an end step actually happens (generally, on your opponent's end step.)
- 1b. Anything that triggers "at the beginning of your next end step" will not trigger during your turn, but it will trigger the next time there is an end step during your turn. You can delay this trigger indefinitely by skipping your end step every turn.
- 1c. Any effect that triggers at the beginning of the end step of a specific turn (see also Final Fortune) will not trigger at all if that turn's end step is skipped.
2. If you activate this during your end step, while a beginning-of-end-step trigger is on the stack, that ability will not resolve. It will not trigger again unle... (see all)
